      • getRenderPass

        public int getRenderPass()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Returns a flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for. The returned value should be the bitwise-OR of any of the following flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Specified by:
        getRenderPass in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Returns:
        A flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for

      • draw

        public final void draw​(GLMapView view,
                       int renderPass)
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable2.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Overrides:
        draw in class GLAsynchronousLayer2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>
        Parameters:
        view - The current view
        renderPass - The render pass being executed during this invocation. The value will be the bitwise-OR of any of the flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Only content valid for the specified pass should be rendered.

      • getRenderList

        protected java.util.Collection<GLMapRenderable2> getRenderList()
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Returns the Collection containing the renderables associated with the current GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.preparedState.

        This method should only ever be invoked in #draw(GLMapView) while holding the lock on this. References to the Collection or any of its elements should not be held outside of that method.

        Specified by:
        getRenderList in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>
        Returns:

      • resetPendingData

        protected void resetPendingData​(java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor> pendingData)
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Reset the pending data object. This method is invoked prior to GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.query(ViewState, Object).

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread while synchronized on this.

        Specified by:
        resetPendingData in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>
        Parameters:
        pendingData - The object that will hold the pending data

      • releasePendingData

        protected void releasePendingData​(java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor> pendingData)
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Release the pending data object. This method is invoked prior to worker thread exiting.

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner.

        Specified by:
        releasePendingData in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>
        Parameters:
        pendingData - The object holding pending data

      • createPendingData

        protected java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor> createPendingData()
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Creates the pending data object. This object will store the result of the asynchronous query such that the renderable and release lists can subsequently be constructed via the invocation of #updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object).

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner.

        Specified by:
        createPendingData in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>
        Returns:
        The object to hold the query result

      • updateRenderList

        protected boolean updateRenderList​(GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.ViewState state,
                                   java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor> pendingData)
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Constructs the render list based on the supplied query result.

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner. It is STRONGLY that this method not be synchronized in a manner that it may block any of the other methods that are synchronized on this as this may serious degrade rendering performance.

        Specified by:
        updateRenderList in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>
        Parameters:
        state - The state that produced the results
        pendingData - The result of the query
        Returns:
        true if the renderable and release lists were brought into sync with the current GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.targetState, false otherwise. If this method returns true, GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.preparedState will take on the state of GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.targetState and the worker will remain idle until GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.checkState() returns false.

      • postProcessRenderables

        protected void postProcessRenderables()

      • newViewStateInstance

        protected GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.ViewState newViewStateInstance()
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Creates a new ViewState instance. This method will be invoked to create the values for GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.targetState, GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.preparedState as well as a temporary ViewState that holds a copy of GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.targetState for the worker thread.

        This method may be invoked off of the GL context thread.

        Overrides:
        newViewStateInstance in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>
        Returns:
        A new ViewState instance.

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: GLLayer2
        Transitions the layer renderer into the Started state. The renderer may only access its subject while in the Started state.

        This method may be invoked from any thread, however, it may never be called concurrently with GLLayer2.stop().

        Specified by:
        start in interface GLLayer2
        Overrides:
        start in class GLAsynchronousLayer2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: GLLayer2
        Transitions the layer renderer into the Stopped state. The renderer may not access its subject until returning to the Started state, however, any renderable content previously derived may continue to be rendered.

        This method may be invoked from any thread, however, it may never be called concurrently with GLLayer2.start().

        Specified by:
        stop in interface GLLayer2
        Overrides:
        stop in class GLAsynchronousLayer2<java.util.LinkedList<DatasetDescriptor>>

      • onSelectionChanged

        public void onSelectionChanged​(RasterLayer2 layer)
        Description copied from interface: RasterLayer2.OnSelectionChangedListener
        This method is invoked when the user specifies a new selection value for the layer.

        Notification for changes to the auto-select value need to be received via the OnAutoSelectValueChangedListener callback.

        Specified by:
        onSelectionChanged in interface RasterLayer2.OnSelectionChangedListener
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer
